snippet: Free restored the ads but its gambit set off a debate on who should pay for the communications networks that carry booming online content.
abstract: France orders Internet service provider Free to stop blocking online advertisements, saying firm has no right to edit Web contents for users; Free restores ads but its gambit sets off debate on who should pay for the communications networks that carry booming online content.
lead_paragraph: Free restored the ads but its gambit set off a debate on who should pay for the communications networks that carry booming online content.

headline.main: France Rejects Plan by Internet Provider to Block Online Ads
headline.print_headline: France Orders a Popular Internet Provider to Stop Blocking Online Ads
